## OpenSearchConfig class

Wrapper of config schema.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class OpenSearchConfig 
```

|  --- | --- | --- |

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [apiVersion](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.apiversion.md) |  | <code>string</code> | Version of the OpenSearch (6.7, 7.1 or <code>master</code>) client will be connecting to. |
|  [customHeaders](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.customheaders.md) |  | <code>OpenSearchConfigType['customHeaders']</code> | Header names and values to send to OpenSearch with every request. These headers cannot be overwritten by client-side headers and aren't affected by <code>requestHeadersWhitelist</code> configuration. |
|  [healthCheckDelay](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.healthcheckdelay.md) |  | <code>Duration</code> | The interval between health check requests OpenSearchDashboards sends to the OpenSearch. |
|  [hosts](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.hosts.md) |  | <code>string[]</code> | Hosts that the client will connect to. If sniffing is enabled, this list will be used as seeds to discover the rest of your cluster. |
|  [ignoreVersionMismatch](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.ignoreversionmismatch.md) |  | <code>boolean</code> | Whether to allow OpenSearch Dashboards to connect to a non-compatible opensearch node. |
|  [logQueries](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.logqueries.md) |  | <code>boolean</code> | Specifies whether all queries to the client should be logged (status code, method, query etc.). |
|  [password](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.password.md) |  | <code>string</code> | If OpenSearch is protected with basic authentication, this setting provides the password that the OpenSearchDashboards server uses to perform its administrative functions. |
|  [pingTimeout](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.pingtimeout.md) |  | <code>Duration</code> | Timeout after which PING HTTP request will be aborted and retried. |
|  [requestHeadersWhitelist](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.requestheaderswhitelist.md) |  | <code>string[]</code> | List of OpenSearchDashboards client-side headers to send to OpenSearch when request scoped cluster client is used. If this is an empty array then \*no\* client-side will be sent. |
|  [requestTimeout](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.requesttimeout.md) |  | <code>Duration</code> | Timeout after which HTTP request will be aborted and retried. |
|  [shardTimeout](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.shardtimeout.md) |  | <code>Duration</code> | Timeout for OpenSearch to wait for responses from shards. Set to 0 to disable. |
|  [sniffInterval](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.sniffinterval.md) |  | <code>false &#124; Duration</code> | Interval to perform a sniff operation and make sure the list of nodes is complete. If <code>false</code> then sniffing is disabled. |
|  [sniffOnConnectionFault](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.sniffonconnectionfault.md) |  | <code>boolean</code> | Specifies whether the client should immediately sniff for a more current list of nodes when a connection dies. |
|  [sniffOnStart](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.sniffonstart.md) |  | <code>boolean</code> | Specifies whether the client should attempt to detect the rest of the cluster when it is first instantiated. |
|  [ssl](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.ssl.md) |  | <code>Pick&lt;SslConfigSchema, Exclude&lt;keyof SslConfigSchema, 'certificateAuthorities' &#124; 'keystore' &#124; 'truststore'&gt;&gt; &amp; {</code><br/><code>        certificateAuthorities?: string[];</code><br/><code>    }</code> | Set of settings configure SSL connection between OpenSearchDashboards and OpenSearch that are required when <code>xpack.ssl.verification_mode</code> in OpenSearch is set to either <code>certificate</code> or <code>full</code>. |
|  [username](./opensearch-dashboards-plugin-core-server.opensearchconfig.username.md) |  | <code>string</code> | If OpenSearch is protected with basic authentication, this setting provides the username that the OpenSearchDashboards server uses to perform its administrative functions. |
